SEARCH
Package uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop

Class TrackSwitch

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop.Cell
uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop.TrackCell
uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop.RailCell
uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop.TrackSwitch
@Deprecated public class TrackSwitch extends RailCell
Deprecated.
This class uses the deprecated RailCell. Consider using CrossingTrack instead.
A track switch (also known as a point or turnout) allows trains to be directed from one track onto one of two possible routes.

The switch has one incoming direction and two possible outgoing directions. Only one of the two outputs is active at a time, and this can be changed by toggling the switch.

Inheritance Hierarchy:

  • Cell (abstract base class)
  • └── TrackCell (abstract class for track)
  • └── RailCell (legacy track implementation)
  • └── TrackSwitch (this class)

Example: A switch might have incoming from WEST, with outputs to EAST (straight) and NORTH (diverging). When toggled, trains can be routed either straight ahead or to the side track.

See Also:
  • TrackCell
  • RailCell

    • TrackSwitch

      public TrackSwitch(Position pos, Orientation incoming, Orientation outputA, Orientation outputB, BufferedImage graphic)
      Deprecated.
      Creates a new track switch at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      pos - the grid position of this switch
      incoming - the direction trains enter from
      outputA - the first possible output direction
      outputB - the second possible output direction
      graphic - the image to display for this switch

  • Method Details

    • getIncoming

      public Orientation getIncoming()
      Deprecated.
      Gets the incoming direction for this switch. Trains must enter the switch from this direction.
      Returns:
      the incoming orientation

    • getActiveOutput

      public Orientation getActiveOutput()
      Deprecated.
      Gets the currently active output direction. Trains will be routed to this direction when they pass through the switch.
      Returns:
      the active output orientation (either outputA or outputB)

    • toggle

      public void toggle()
      Deprecated.
      Toggles the switch between its two output directions. If outputA was active, outputB becomes active, and vice versa.

    • hasConnection

      public boolean hasConnection(Orientation o)
      Deprecated.
      Checks if this switch has a connection in the specified orientation. The switch always allows the incoming direction and the currently active output.
      Overrides:
      hasConnection in class RailCell
      Parameters:
      o - the orientation to check
      Returns:
      true if there is a connection in the given direction
